intro: Hieracium catharyllum, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually basal, spoon-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium catharyllum is often found in meadows and slopes at high elevations, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
